definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
birds and animals/the beasts of the field and the birds of the air

sentences.english: Even the wild animals pant for you;
Its movements imitated the motion of five kinds of birds and beasts.
sentences.chinese: 其招式就模仿了五种飞禽走兽的动作。

sentences.english: Our wisdom can only control the animals but not humans.
sentences.chinese: 人们的智慧能控制飞禽走兽，却无法控制自己。

sentences.english: Lebanon is not sufficient for altar fires, nor its animals enough for burnt offerings.
sentences.chinese: 利巴嫩的树林不彀当柴烧，其中的走兽也不彀作燔祭。

sentences.english: And Lebanon is not sufficient to burn, nor the beasts thereof sufficient for a burnt offering.
sentences.chinese: 黎巴嫩的树林不够当柴烧，其中的走兽也不够作燔祭。

sentences.english: 2in Which were all the four- footed animals and reptiles of the earth and birds of heaven.
sentences.chinese: 2里面有地上各样四足的走兽和爬物，并天空的飞鸟。

sentences.english: He provides food for the cattle and for the young ravens when they call.
sentences.chinese: 他赐食给走兽，和啼叫的小乌鸦。

sentences.english: 2in Which were all the four-footed animals and reptiles of the earth and birds of heaven.
sentences.chinese: 2里面有地上各样四足的走兽和爬物，并天空的飞鸟。

sentences.english: And for thy cattle， and for the beast that are in thy land， shall all the increase thereof be meat.
sentences.chinese: 这年的土产也要给你的牲畜和你地上的走兽当食物。

sentences.english: They give drink to every beast of the field; here wild asses quench their thirst .
sentences.chinese: 供给各种走兽水喝，使野驴也得以解渴。

sentences.english: He giveth to the beast his food, and to the young ravens which cry.
sentences.chinese: 他赐食给走兽，和啼叫的小乌鸦。

sentences.english: They give water to all the beasts of the field; the wild donkeys quench their thirst.
sentences.chinese: 使野地的走兽有水喝，野驴得解其渴。
试想飞禽走兽如何降生。

sentences.english: Lions, bears, cows, and horses are beasts .
sentences.chinese: 狮子，熊，牛，和马都是走兽。

sentences.english: Wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.
sentences.chinese: 里面有地上各样四足的走兽，和昆虫，并天上的飞鸟。

sentences.english: I also see that there are so many birds and beats entirely at your feet, right under your beautiful velvet skirt.
sentences.chinese: 我也知道有很多飞禽走兽拜倒在你的天鹅绒裙下。

definition: birds and animals/the beasts of the field and the birds of the air
Ratitae (formerly Cursores) flightless birds such as ostriches
water flea (small crustacean of genus Daphnia)
insect or insect-like small creature (literary)/base person (used as a curse word)
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
